etymologies: Old English rǣdan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch raden and German raten ‘advise, guess’. Early senses included ‘advise’ and ‘interpret (a riddle or dream’) (see rede)

definitions: look at and comprehend the meaning of (written or printed matter) by mentally interpreting the characters or symbols of which it is composed

examples.text: it's the best novel I've ever read
I never learned to read music
I'll go to bed and read for a while

shortDefinitions: look at and comprehend meaning of written or printed matter

definitions: have the ability to look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter

examples.text: only three of the girls could read and none could write

shortDefinitions: have ability to look at and comprehend meaning of written or printed matter

definitions: speak (the written or printed matter that one is reading) aloud, typically to another person

examples.text: I'll read to you if you like
his mother read him a bedtime story

shortDefinitions: speak aloud

definitions: habitually read (a particular newspaper or journal)

examples.text: now, I know what my reputation is—I read the papers

shortDefinitions: habitually read

definitions: (of a passage, text, or sign) contain or consist of specified words; have a certain wording

examples.text: the placard read “We want justice.”

shortDefinitions: have certain wording

definitions: used to indicate that a particular word in a text or passage is incorrect and that another should be substituted for it

examples.text: for madam read madman

shortDefinitions: used to indicate that particular word in text or passage is incorrect

definitions: discover (information) by reading it in a written or printed source

examples.text: he was arrested yesterday—I read it in the paper
I read about the course in a magazine

shortDefinitions: discover information by reading it in written or printed source

definitions: discern (a fact, emotion, or quality) in someone's eyes or expression

examples.text: she looked down, terrified that he would read fear on her face

shortDefinitions: discern fact, emotion, or quality in someone's eyes or expression

definitions: understand or interpret the nature or significance of

examples.text: he didn't dare look away, in case this was read as a sign of weakness

shortDefinitions: understand or interpret nature or significance of

definitions: (of a piece of writing) convey a specified impression to the reader

examples.text: the brief note read like a cry for help

shortDefinitions: convey specified impression to reader

definitions: inspect and record the figure indicated on (a measuring instrument)

examples.text: I've come to read the gas meter

shortDefinitions: inspect and record figure indicated on

definitions: (of a measuring instrument) indicate a specified measurement or figure

examples.text: the thermometer read 0° C

shortDefinitions: indicate specified measurement or figure

definitions: study (an academic subject) at a university

examples.text: I'm reading English at Cambridge

shortDefinitions: study academic subject at university

definitions: (of a computer) copy, transfer, or interpret (data)

examples.text: it attempts to read a floppy disk without regard to its format

shortDefinitions: (of computer) copy, transfer, or interpret

definitions: enter or extract (data) in an electronic storage device

examples.text: the most common way of reading a file into the system

shortDefinitions: enter or extract data in electronic storage device

definitions: (of a device) obtain data from (light or other input)

examples.text: the microchip gives a unique code when read by the scanner

shortDefinitions: (of device) obtain data from

definitions: hear and understand the words of (someone speaking on a radio transmitter)

examples.text: “Do you read me? Over.”

shortDefinitions: hear and understand words of

definitions: a person's interpretation of something

examples.text: their read on the national situation may be correct

shortDefinitions: person's interpretation of something

definitions: a book considered in terms of its readability

examples.text: the book is a thoroughly entertaining read

shortDefinitions: book considered in terms of its readability

definitions: a period or act of reading something

examples.text: I was having a quiet read of the newspaper

shortDefinitions: period or act of reading something

definitions: having a specified level of knowledge as a result of reading

examples.text: Ada was well read in French literature
a man deeply read in history, philosophy, and theology

shortDefinitions: having specified level of knowledge as result of reading

definitions: having a readership of a specified extent

examples.text: it is still a widely read newspaper
a little-read English columnist whose name escapes me

shortDefinitions: having readership of specified extent
